--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Derek James <blue5432@y...> wrote:
> --- Kenneth Stanley <kstanley@c...> wrote:
> > You could just evaluate it against all 19,683
> > possible board 
> > positions, either as fitness, or just for testing. 
> > The score
> > is how many of the 19,683 moves are the same as that
> > proposed by 
> > BEST. (note that many of these are actually
> > irrelevant since
> > they already represent winning positions, so ignore
> > those)
> 
> Yes, and symmetries can also be ignored.  This makes
> sense.  It wouldn't be that difficult to sit down and
> figure out all the possible legal moves for all
> possible legal board states, excluding symmetry, and
> determine what the best moves are for each.
> 

Is it right to ignore symmetries?  Don't you have to train/test
the net's ability to deal with them?

ken
